page.title: 17NOTABLE EVENTS,READING
page.content: {The Dee Road Estate}was started in the late 60s and was of Bovis construction It origanally consised of nearly 1000 dwellings;a mixture of houses,flats, maisonettes and old peoples homes.At the time it was considered a show piece and opened by the Dutchess of Kent.The centre of the estate is lyon square an open space planted with ornamental trees and shrubs.To one side there is a small shopping precinct.Close to lyon square are Raniket junior and infant School catering for children aged 3\-11yrs. The junior school was opened in November 1970 and the infant school in September 1973.The name Raniket was given to the school since the Dee Road estate was built close to the site of a war time (1939-45)army camp of that name.In 1983 it was decided to demolish the flats.
